fields.summary: When displaying more charts on one screen, colors should be same for the same type of status to avoid confusion and improve readibility
Manage Dashboard: Popularity column in "My" tab
List projects by category in create issue page
In the Issue Navigator, the multi-select field display is not wide enough to show full values
User default language dropdown should display language names in own language

fields.description:
In our project the field "Fixed Version/s" is set to hidden in the field configuration. The field "Affects Version/s" is shown. Nevertheless the field "Fix for:" is displayed if I create a new filter. This is very misleading, because the users mix up the both version fields as they do not know that there are two different version fields.
My wish: Please so not display "Fix For" for filters, when the field is hidden for the selected projects.
fields.summary: Hide "Fix for" in filter edit page if field "Fixed Version/s" is hidden

fields.description:
Is it possible to create filters or saved searches compromising a number of specified (but otherwise unrelated) issues?

I know you could acheive this through the watchlist, but this only allows for one group of issues per user. We would like to group together issues into a single view on the Issue Navigator that might not be otherwise grouped by a version or field.

A bit like creating a group, except with bugs instead of users :)
fields.summary: Group together specific unrelated issues into filter
Stacked Bar chart to track issue priorities over time

fields.description:
If an issue query contains a square bracket (such as if it's sorted on a custom field), the resulting permalink URL is not properly url-escaped (the [ ] should be replaced with %5B %5D). 

This has the unfortunate effect that if I try to paste that permalink into a confluence wiki page, the resulting link doesn't work because the ] in the url terminates the link.
fields.summary: Square brackets in issue filter permalinks are not URL-escaped

fields.description:
Hello,

Some of our customers are running really large JIRA instance.

One of them reported us that they have more than 200 statuses each of them are associated with workflows (there are over 70) within JIRA, and loading "status" page on the administration screen takes very long time.

Can you reproduce this problem, and if that's the case on your side as well, we would like you to implement the feature 
like allowing multiple tabs on "status" screen and be able to control the number of statuses per tab.

They are using Dual core CPU plus 2GB memory of which 1GB is allocated to JVM so we suppose the hardware is not the bottleneck 
within their site.
fields.summary: Loading the "status" page takes long time when the number of statuses is very large

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Startup JIRA with VM parameters {noformat}-Duser.language=de -Duser.country=DE{noformat}
# Ensure that English UK is set both as the global default and the current user's preferred language
# Observe as everything is still in German

We believe this is because there are no actual language files for en_UK and we rely on the default language bundle to be chosen in their absence, but somehow the JVM chooses the DE language bundle before considering the default one.

Furthermore, If you change the language to English US, *most things* will correctly translate to English, but some things still remain in German (Issue Types in the quick create section of Browse Project, for example).
fields.summary: CLONE -English UK translation does not work when the VM locale is not English

fields.description:
Hi Atlassian Team,

I want to know, if there es a possibility to create a clone of an issue and move this clone to a different project.
The special about this cloned issue is, that it should be read only and it should be "hard linked" the to original one.
The cloned issue cannot be changed, only the original one can be changed. This change automatically updates the clone.
Or, if possible this update could be in both directions. So if the clone is updated, it updates the original as well.

Is there any functionality in JIRA right now?

Greetings
Michael
fields.summary: Create some kind of "read only linked clone" in a different project

fields.description:
We have severe performance problems with users at client sites who use IE7 and have high-latency SSL connections. As this affects a large portion of our 1000-odd users, this prevents us from upgrading to 4.0.1. This is a disadvantage of the gadget architecture, and I cannot see it going away soon.

I'd like to air a half-baked idea: Would it be possible to construct an *optional, alternative dashboard* rendering engine, which would render the gadget, including all its data _on the server_? It would act as a kind of "proxy" to the user's browser, in fact emulating a browser and sending one stream of fully rendered HTML to the client's browser. As this would all happen in one request between client and server, latency and JavaScript performance would not matter. Within the gadgets, all the same mechanisms and calls as in 4.0 would take place, but on the server, with virtually zero latency. 

As said, this would be an optional alternative Dashboard, perhaps best controlled through a user setting, and/or an URL parameter.

It would keep all the API and advantages of open gadgets, without the performance penalties incurred in legacy / constrained environments.

Best regards,
Martin
fields.summary: Optionally render dashboard on the server for high-latency / IE users - single GET would retrieve dashboard like on 3.x, but with 4.x Gadgets

fields.description: As we have a great number of projects we would like projectleaders to have an overview of all (resolved) issues of their projects. These projectleaders are project-users in other projects. At this moment I cannot filter out the projects where I'm onle a regular user.
fields.summary: Filter on project_lead
Please provide rights to put request for service part creation to me

fields.description: Each block of comment has a anchor like this {{}}. The problem is that is interpreted by most browsers as and not as . In fact, is not valid HMTL 4.01 Transitional. This can cause rendering problems if another tag is not started directly after (i.e. if the commenter has been deleted).
fields.summary: Invalid HTML in the comments section of JIRA.
JIRA currently cannot search for colons (:) in text fields or this feature appears to be broken.
NullPointerException when search engine robot tries to view IssueNavigator

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create an issue
# Change the description and update other fields
# Leave a required field empty like the summary field
# Press submit button
# Get error message
# Click on some other link
# *No warning* that your data will be lost
fields.summary: Issue 'Navigate away' warning not displayed after 'blank mandatory field' warning

fields.description:
We have just migrated from FogBugz to JIRA. In FogBugz, when viewing a list of issues (i.e. the Navigator in JIRA) you could see the last comment made on the issue. This was very helpful for our developers and they've asked if it can be added to JIRA.

Basically, it would just mean that in the area where you can customize your Navigator columns you could add a 'Last Comment'.

Is this something you can incorporate into a future update? I've attached a screenshot showing you what I mean.
fields.summary: Display last comment in Navigator Column

fields.description:
The screenshot applet doesn't open due to a javascript error when a group name includes quotes (").  They quotes aren't being escaped properly in the json configuration that is included on the page thus breaking the javascript.

For example with a group called 'Team "Road Map"' and groups as well as project roles enabled for comment security levels you get this bit of javascript in the page which breaks (notice 'comment.group.name.0':"Team "Road Map""):
{noformat}
<script>
    var version = '1.5';
    var attributes = {
        codebase:"/jira/secure/",
    	code:"com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreenshotApplet.class",
        archive:"applet/screenshot.jar",
        width:710,
        height:540
    };
    var parameters = {
        scriptable:"false",
        post:"AttachFile.jspa?attachScreenshot=true",
        issue:10001,
        screenshotname:"screenshot-1",
        after:"ManageAttachments!default.jspa?id=10001",
        encoding:"UTF-8",
        useragent:"Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.2) Gecko/20100115 Firefox/3.6",
        'comment.group.name.0':"Team "Road Map"",
        'comment.group.name.1':"jira-developers",
        'comment.group.name.2':"jira-administrators",
        'comment.group.name.3':"jira-users",
        'comment.role.0':"10002|Administrators",
        'comment.role.1':"10001|Developers",
        'comment.role.2':"10000|Users",
        'paste.text':"Paste",
        'filename.text':"File name:",
        'errormsg.filename.text':"ERROR: The filename must not contain the characters:",
        'comment.text':"Update comment:",
        'attach.text':"Attach",
        'cancel.text':"Cancel",
        'badconfiguration.text':"Bad Applet Configuration.",
        'comment.level.text':"Comment Viewable By",
        'allusers.text':"All Users",
        'projectroles.text':"Project Roles",
        'groups.text':"Groups",
        'security.text':"Applet security not setup correctly.  You must accept this applet's certificate for it to run."
    };
    deployJava.runApplet(attributes, parameters, version);
</script>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Attach screenshot link doesn't work if group name includes "
A new sharing permission for "editing" filters and dashboards should be created

fields.description: JRA-16303 specifies that minor versions don't display a text label by design. I am asking Atlassian to either change this decision or at least make it configurable.
fields.summary: Resolved vs Created chart should display text label for minor versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20230].
  {panel}

When I use JIRA as a time tracking mechanism (eg JDOG and GreenHopper) I often want to get a report of "the time I have logged in the last week"

This would help me know if I have been keeping up to date in my logging of work.


It would be great therefore I if could get a report of "issues that have time logged against them by me".

It would look a lot like the current "project time tracking report" but per use and per "time frame" instead of per project.

My main use case is "I want to know what I have logged time against recently" so that I dont double up and also so I know if I am lagging behind.

I short this is a simple per use summary so that one cdan ensure they get a  quick view of where they are up to for the week/iteration/whatever...
fields.summary: Have a time tacking report for a user.  All time logged in the last week.

fields.description:
This occurs when we restart our servers.  The shutdown script is run, the server is rebooted, the startup script is run.  Each logged in user will get this error on the Home page.  This can be fixed by shutting it down again and restarting it, or sometimes you have to clear out the work/Catalina directory.  No data seems to be lost.

NPE from null user in bulk mail

fields.description:
I am unsure if this should be a JIRA or FishEye bug, as it is a bug with the plugin.
Repro Steps:
Set resolution to 1024x768 (our laptops have this as native resolution)
Select a project that has source code management hooked in through Fisheye
Select "Source" on the right hand side
Select "Statistics"

Note that you cannot see all of the information to the right, and cannot scroll to see it either.

This bug is now being tracked here: https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/FISH-378
fields.summary: In 1024x768 resolution, cannot scroll horizontally in Fisheye report

fields.description: It would be nice if you could drag and drop issues from one release to another in the roadmap overview screen of a project.
fields.summary: Allow drag-and-drop on roadmap overview screen

fields.description:
I know about votes and watches per issue, about "labels", and about the principle of favourite filters.
Would you like to consider the option to declare issues 'favourite', across all projects, irrespective of whether they can be combined in 1 query?

Thanks
fields.summary: Request for possibility  to mark issues as 'favourite'

fields.description:
The LDAP Configurer tool in JIRA generates the following XML for the Profile and Access Providers:

{code}
    <provider class="com.opensymphony.user.provider.ofbiz.OFBizProfileProvider">
        <property name="exclusive-access">true</property>
    </provider>

    <provider class="com.opensymphony.user.provider.ofbiz.OFBizAccessProvider">
        <property name="exclusive-access">true</property>
    </provider>
{code}

However, this is the XML we ship with:

{code}
    <provider class="com.atlassian.jira.user.osuser.JiraOFBizProfileProvider">
		<property name="exclusive-access">true</property>
	</provider>

	<provider class="com.atlassian.jira.user.osuser.JiraOFBizAccessProvider">
		<property name="exclusive-access">true</property>
	</provider>
{code}

The Configurer needs to change to generate the new XML.
fields.summary: LDAP Configurer doesn't use new JIRA-specific Profile and Access providers

fields.description:
Jeremy,

This document has recently been moved into the JRA space:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+a+Project+Key+with+Different+Formats
(...it possibly contains some typos as a result of the move, e.g. there are several occurrences of "JIRAKB")

It appears to expand on this document:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Project+Keys

Rather than have two similar docs, could you please combine them, then delete the one that has recently been moved?

Many thanks,
Rosie
fields.summary: combine docs on "Configuring Project Keys"

fields.description:
If you offered a direct email-dropbox as Highrise does for deals and cases, that would be very useful. If I get an email from a customer I could just forward it to that address and the attachements and the mail would be imported automatically. 

Please see the attached screenshot for more information.
fields.summary: Offer an email-dropbox in Jira, that will allow email imports directly to an issue

fields.description: If I add the resolution field to the default screen (it's the only field not added by default) it shows up on every issue when I click 'edit'. Since the field has no unset option (and it's a required field), this has the side effect of setting a resolution to any issue which I edit - even on open issues, and I can't remove a resolution (because there's no unset option).
fields.summary: 'resolution' field should only be displayed on a 'screen' when the issue is closed
Deal with bad network connections more gracefully

fields.description:
When I do anything that has buttons on the bottom of the form (Comments, Edit Case, etc.), between the two buttons, I see:

 id="" accesskey="S" title="Press Alt+S to submit form" class="spaced " />

No matter what the two buttons appear to do, if they are buttons that submit the form, I get this text.  Any idea what might have gone wrong?
fields.summary: Button Information Visible Between Buttons

fields.description: We should really have a bundled gadget that just displays all the details of a single JIRA issue.  A number of Confluence customers have asked how they can view an single JIRA issue on a Confluence page and right now all they can do is create a filter for the issue with lots of columns, which isn't ideal.
fields.summary: Gadget that displays a JIRA Issue

fields.description:
I am creating a dashboard that shows individuals the sub-tasks that are currently assigned to them. Unfortunately, many teams have tasks with duplicate tasks in many stories (for example, QA Review is on just about every tech story). Without the Parent Issue Summary, the filter display on the dashboard is meaningless. 

There used to be a plugin that would do this in 3.13 but it is currently unsupported in 4.0. This functionality needs to be built into JIRA.
fields.summary: Make the Parent Issue Summary field available as a selectable field for filter display

fields.description:
Currently, when I add a new custom field, it will be available in all field configurations, and I need to go through all the field configurations to hide the field.

Actually, what I want is that it is added as a hidden field.
fields.summary: Hide new custom fields by default in the field configuration schemes
test

fields.description: Check screenshot
fields.summary: HTML type in the configure logging form

fields.description:
Currently when you do a permissions check of a subtask, the parent issue has to be retrieved (from the database) to also check it's permissions.  We should look into if there's any optimisations that we can do here (perhaps we don't actually need to retrieve the whole issue from the db, caching the parent issue for subsequent requests etc).

This issue can cause slowdowns in Greenhopper currently when viewing a planning board with a lot of subtasks, since Greenhopper does a lot of permission checks up front.
fields.summary: Permission checks for subtasks end up loading the parent issue from the database

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:
1) Create a Select list custom field
2) Associate with a screen
4) For several issues give null values
4) Add a statistics filter for relevant project or filter with this field: 
a) statistic type: the custom field
b) sort by natural

You should see "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource"

Notes: Sort by natural results in no problems. It does not make a difference whether this is a required field or not.
fields.summary: statistics filter problem with select list custom field

fields.description:
Here are a couple of features/modifications I would like to suggest for zira.

1. Ability to store signatures.
2. Having the ability to unassign tickets with one-click the same way tickets can be assigned "to me."
3. Removing unnecessary ticket statuses.
4. Adding a "time spent" field in all ticket update methods to help speed things up as opposed to manually clicking on log work every single time to log in the time spent on the ticket.

-Muhammad
fields.summary: Few suggestions

fields.description:
Here some customization requests related to Link Features.

We have define that ISSUE-1556 block ISSUE-1555 that block ISSUE-1557.

1.       Automatically "Waiting for" for ISSUE-1557
When we define that ISSUE-1557 is blocked by ISSUE-1555 (or ISSUE-1555 block ISSUE-1557), ISSUE-1557 should be put automatically as "Waiting For"

2.       Automatically "ReOpen" for ISSUE-1557
When all the blocking issue linked to ISSUE-1557 are in Resolved/Fixed, then -1557 is automatically put as "Reopened"

3.       Condition the transition to Resolved for ISSUE-1557.
Alive 1557 should be able to pass in Resolved status only if ISSUE-1555 and ISSUE-1556 are resolved themselves firstly.
If ISSUE-1555 and ISSUE-1557 are not resolved, ISSUE-1557 cannot be put as Resolved
fields.summary: Link and workflow transition improovement

fields.description:
Have Jira use Apache Authentication. It is possible to pass Apache's REMOTE_USER system variable to Apache. Have Jira look at this and override it's own authentication mechanism. This variable could even be set using mod_auth_kerb, thus enabling full SSO.

Using the attached PHP script, and runing it from the cron, would enable you to manage all you Jira users completely from AD.
fields.summary: Apache authentication

fields.description:
This is the affected page:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+JIRA%27s+log+output

This is true until JIRA 3.13.5 and not after the release of JIRA 4.0 or JIRA 4.0.1. 

This content in {{log4j.properties}}:
{noformat}
log4j.category.com.atlassian = WARN, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian = false
{noformat}

Should be changed to:
{noformat}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian = WARN, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian = false
{noformat}

This applies to both in JIRA Standalone and also in JIRA deployed as a Webapp.
fields.summary: Inaccurate content in Changing JIRA's log output documentation

Add message/ note to reflect the status of SMTP server

fields.description:
Hello,

We have seen a Issue that on Issue navigator shows Resolution="SIN RESOLVER" and Status="Promocionada" and on issue details appears Resolution="Resuelto" and Status="Cerrada".

Do you know what is the problem and how can we resolve it?

Thanks a lot
fields.summary: Different issue Status and Resolution between Issue Navigator and Issue Details

fields.description: In large instances optimises can take a really long time.  Currently getting a searcher will wait for the optimise to complete which will make your instance seem unresponsive.  Getting a searcher shouldn't have to wait for an optimize to finish.
fields.summary: Getting a Searcher should not wait for optimise

fields.description:
After a restart if a request is sent to rpc/soap then the RPC service can get into a weird state where it doesn't register any methods from the JIRASoapService.  Axis merely displays:
{noformat}
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
{noformat}
And visiting the correct URL of rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl shows a wsdl without any services.

h5. Workaround
A restart fixes the problem (as long as the first request obviously goes to rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl not just rpc/soap).
fields.summary: RPC service can get into a strange state when hitting rpc/soap instead of rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl after restart

fields.description:
The existing [Integrating JIRA with Apache using SSL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL] KB article does not specifically cover the common scenario where HTTPS is terminated on the proxy server.
e.g:  Client Browser --> HTTPS --> Apache proxy --> HTTP --> Tomcat/JIRA

Specifically a HTTP Connector needs to be defined (identical to the default 8080 Connector) with the addition of the following attributes:
scheme="https", proxyName="<proxy_server>", proxyPort="<proxy_port>"

Default connector:
{code:xml}
<Connector port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1"
               connectionTimeout="20000"
               redirectPort="8443"
               URIEncoding="UTF-8"
               useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
 />
{code}


Connector that supports HTTPS terminated on the proxy server:
{code:xml}
<Connector port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1"
               connectionTimeout="20000"
               redirectPort="8443"
               URIEncoding="UTF-8"
               useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
              
               <!-- The below are new lines to add - the above is untouched -->
               scheme="https"
               proxyName="<proxy_server>"
               proxyPort="443"
 />
{code}

In this scenario, the Apache httpd.conf file needs to be modified from:
{noformat}
ProxyPass              /jira       https://localhost:8443/jira
ProxyPassReverse       /jira       https://localhost:8443/jira
{noformat}

to

{noformat}
ProxyPass              /jira       http://localhost:8080/jira
ProxyPassReverse       /jira       http://localhost:8080/jira
{noformat}
(Note the changes to the scheme and port).
fields.summary: Improvement to 'Integrating JIRA with Apache using SSL' KB

fields.summary: Feature of labelling issues

fields.description:
After fixing JRA-20038, Projects in the cache will be updated a lot more often.
This has turned up a problem where it is usually invalid to compare two project objects with project1.equals(project2)
This is because this checks ALL fields including the counter field which is constantly updated.
This equals compare can now return false for two project objects that actually represent the same project.

This problem exists for comparing Project GenericValues as well as ProjectImpl objects.
fields.summary: Need to check all calls to project.equals() for correct behaviour.

fields.description:
In the workflow editor post-functions view it's possible to re-order certain post-functions that shouldn't be re-ordered.  For example in the Create transition it's possible to end up with the index post function *before* the create issue function which ends up with a NullPointerException when creating an issue.

To reproduce this click Move Down/Move up on a post function and before the page has reloaded click Move Down/Move up again (on different post functions etc).  Seems like a concurrency issue.  It can be a little tricky to re-produce, but the attached screenshot proofs it's possible.

To fix up the borked workflow afterwards, one needs to export the workflow to XML, fix up the order in the XML file and re-import the workflow.
fields.summary: Workflow post-functions can be put into an invalid order via the workflow editor UI

fields.description:
Basic steps to reproduce are as follows:
- Create a group
- Add group to user with no administrative functions
- Assign a group to a project role
- Delete the group
- Attempt to login to system with the user. Note error
- As administrator, attempt to unassign the group from the project role. Note error.
fields.summary: Deletion of group with project role denies user login

fields.description:
When I compared the result of the filter vs those displayed by the gadget for the same filter, I realised that the query used by the gadget has been modified by it. The resolution field is used in the gadget but not in my filter!! I made sure that it was the same filter for both. 
Check the jpg. No 1 is the result of the filter and number 2 is the result of the gadget. The resolution field is use with the gadget!

Plus since we are testing the version 4.0.1 in a lab, I can compare the result with our JIRA prod(3.13) and yes, both results (filter and portlet)are the same!


Please close, i transfered this issue to support:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-51089
fields.summary: The result of a filter is not the same in my filter list vs what is displayed by the statistique gadget. (the filter is accurate, the gadget is not)
Store "Smart Query" as filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20178].
  {panel}

We have a need to filter on version substrings so we can find all issues that affect a growing list of versions.

for example we have the following version strings:
4.1 (mainlatest)
4.1 (next)
4.1 rev 7.010
T 4.1 rev 7.018 
V 4.1 rev 7
C 4.1 rev 6.012

What we'd like to do is construct filters that simply use the tilde operator (contains) so we can have a filter based on the unique substring per version i.e. affectedVersion ~ "4.1 "

Currently doing a 'smart query' for v:4.1 returns the correct set of results, but we cannot save this as an auto-updating filter
fields.summary: Allow use of "contains" for affectedVersion and fixForVersions

fields.description:
Trying to check the Active User Count using *com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.getActiveUserCount()*, one of my customer encounters the following exception :
{code}
com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: org.codehaus.xfire.XFireRuntimeException: Could not invoke service.. Nested exception is org.codehaus.xfire.fault.XFireFault: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.getInterruptibly(LazyReference.java:152)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.get(LazyReference.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.ResettableLazyReference.get(ResettableLazyReference.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.getActiveUserCount(UserUtilImpl.java:370)
{code}

The calls is done in a Service initied during the start of JIRA (See http://www.minyaa.com/jira/browse/MYAA-465).

What is the way to avoid such error : May I catch the exception and try in loop ?

Regards
Vincent
fields.summary: org.codehaus.xfire.XFireRuntimeException on ActiveUserCount value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20166].
  {panel}

In JIRA 3.13.5 and lower, it was possible to move sub-tasks from one project to another and end up with components data from the previous project after the move(JRA-17312).

Users upgrading to JIRA 4.0 and higher who use Greenhopper may experience problems as a result of corrupted data.  There is a manual fix described here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Greenhopper+throws+NullPointerExceptions+when+components+are+corrupt...

It would be helpful to have an additional integrity check to look for and fix components that are associated with the wrong project.
fields.summary: Add a check for corrupt component data to the Integrity Checker

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20162].
  {panel}

Due to the change introduced in jira 4.0 Dashboard framework, we are not able to print the dashboard properly. we can see only one or two pages, other pages are not printing and even the charts are not able to print fully. This problem can be replicated in all browsers. But in earlier version, for example 3.13.5, there is a Print icon and print was proper. It is good to maintain the same print feature in the latest releases.

As per discussion with support developer, we decided that it is a bug in the jira 4.0 

And we have support request for this bug- https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-50228

Please find the attached dashboard PDF for reference.
fields.summary: Improve CSS on Dashboard in order to produce printing friendly content.

fields.description:
From http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+Make+a+JIRA+Patch:

*Steps to Replicate*
The maven build command doesn't work:
# Download the 4.0.1 source distro from http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/JIRASourceDownloads.jspa
# Unzip
# CD into the root of the unzipped directory, and then into the jira directory
# Run {{maven idea}}
The following error is thrown:
{code}
>> ParseError at [row,col]:[1629,28]
Message: Unrecognised tag: 'm2-transitive'
{code}

*Workaround*
# edit atlassian-jira-enterprise-4.0.1-source/jira/
# Delete the line <m2-transitive>true</m2-transitive> from line 1629
# Rerun {{maven idea}}
fields.summary: project.xml improperly formatted in source distro

fields.description:
We found that our subtask can be set a In Progress when their Parrent Story are still Open.
To avoid this situation, it should be greate to add a new workflow condition to transition: Parent-Task Blocking Condition.

This new transition is the same thing that Sub-Task Blocking Condition but for the parent Issue.
fields.summary: Add a new workflow condition to transition: Parent-Task Blocking Condition

fields.description:
We are using Jira with Crowd User Management. 

If an issue A has been reported by user A and user A is deleted from Active Directory (which is a common use case), issue A can not be edited any more. Even not by an administrator with full permissions. If an administrator tries this, an exception occurs. An administrator with full permission should always be able to edit all issues. 

If an issue A has been reported by user A and user A is renamed in Active Directory (because he has married and his user name is build with the last name), issue A can not be edited any more. Even not by an administrator with full permissions. If an administrator tries this, an exception occurs. An administrator with full permission should always be able to edit all issues. 

Actually we can not do anything with these issues (even cloning, bulk editing, changing the reporter does not work). 

Because users frequently leave the company or marry etc. the number of issues which are not usable any more is getting bigge and bigger. This will lead soon to a unusable system
fields.summary: Exception when Issue is edited where the reporter has been removed from Active Directory

fields.description:
We recently upgraded to Jira 4.0.  We had a pending configuration issue, to which we found some kind of solutions: 
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+validators+to+make+custom+fields+required+on+transition+screens 
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Suite+Utilities
Both Links and the solutions proposed there seem to be deprecated, for Jira 4. 

So my question where is the workaround for the much wanted feature: "Make a (Custom)Field required in a certain Workflow transition" 
How can this be set up in Jira 4?
fields.summary: Required Fields on Workflow-transition

fields.description:
HI Jira,

 

I notice the "Assigned to Me" gadgets only display results that are unresolved. Our team has our own flow as agreed by our manager where we still need to see the issues assigned to us so long its not closed. 

 

I want to request to change the current "Assigned to Me" gadgets for the following user below to display only issues that ONLY have this criteria:-

1) Assignee: Current user

2) Sorted by: Priority descending, then Created ascending

3) Status: Not closed

 

Peh Peng Ean
 30071743 
 pengean.peh@acs-inc.com 
 
Karen Wong Khoay Ling
 30073718
 khoayling.wong@acs-inc.com
 
Joanne Lee Yoke Chun
 30073049
 joanne.lee@acs-inc.com 
 
Grace Tin 
 30032644
 Grace.tin@acs-inc.com
 
Nurul Husna Zahari
 30047798
 NurulHusna.Zahari@acs-inc.com
 

 

The reason is we want to see the issues even after they are resolved and but before it's being closed. 

Please advice whether it could be done. If can, please let me know once it's done. 

 

Thanks and Regards,

Grace Tin
fields.summary: Request to add "Assigned to me" gadget to show issues that are not closed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-20141].
  {panel}

One thing we have a problem with from a usability point of view (as do you I realize when entering this enhancement request) is that the number of Component/s / Versions that are available in the drop downs can be very long, making it awkward to actually select components/versions. 

I know it is possible to search by typing, but it doesn't work that well in practice any more, as we've had to prepend e.g. our components with a category to make it possible to find anything at all...

I would propose a couple of possible improvements to this, but I'm sure you can think of even better approaches - but to get you started:

1. List browser sizes should be configurable for e.g. "Create issue" screen, allowing them to be bigger - this would be a simple change, but make things much, much better than currently (only seeing 5 items is just not usable, I'd like 10-15 - having this per-user configurable would be one option).

2. Add some more sophisticated search facility that doesn't just to prefix searching, but does full string matching and restricts the displayed results, similar to how iTunes/Spotlight searches work 

3. Some sort of favorite history with a separate checkbox to "show all" for the list, with the ability to hide things over time - e.g. I'd only work with very few releases at a given point in time, although there may be a fair amount of historical releases that are still active out at customer sites and thus displayed

The main problem though, is really that the large UI workflow stumble-block, is to find the right item in these lists which can be long (we have the same problem with our "Customer" list where we assign which customer a case affects). Just as a reference, it took me probably 30-60 seconds just to find the right component to file this case for, as I had to slowly scroll through the list.
fields.summary: Better support for large selection lists (e.g. "components" in 'create issue' sccreen)
Removing system fields from the view issue screen.

fields.description:
While most issue pages that have image attachments load quite quickly, it seems that certain images cause the issue page to take a very long time to load.

As an experiment I created two issues, each with 12 image attachments (two different sets).

The issue with images from set 1 loads in around 2 seconds. The images in this set range from about 500KB to 6MB.

The issue with images from set 2 loads in around 15 seconds. The images in this set range from about 500KB to 600KB.
fields.summary: Loading an issue page with certain image attachments is unexpectedly slow
